results.title: The Favourite costume sketch of Queen Anne's robes
results.brief_description:
Costume designer Sandy Powell begins her design process with the script. Once she knows the story, she consults with directors on how they envision the characters. Then she fills books - divided into chapters on each character - with research images before she sources fabric. Choosing the kinds of fabric she will use is one of the most important parts of Powell’s process – the fabric gives her the idea for her costumes.    

In The Favourite (2018), Powell uses historically accurate silhouettes but modern materials like second-hand denim, fake leather and vinyl. While you might think costume designers always sketch their designs first, many don’t, including Powell, who dives straight into creating the costumes. She only makes the sketches after she knows what the costumes look like and the actors have tested them.

results.title: The Fauves
results.creator_credit: Victoria. Education Dept. Audio-Visual Resources Branch and Ross Campbell
results.brief_description: The Fauves were a group of artists centred around Henri Matisse, who worked together for a period of two years. The style was a mixture of technique with features derived from Sevrat, Van Gogh and later, Gauguin. The Fauves proclaimed the value of the formal elements in a painting. Their ideas greatly influenced the course of twentieth century art intended to be a stimulating resource material for senior art students. Music by Claude Debussy, Alexander Scriabin and Alan Hovhaness.

results.title: The Fate of the universe
results.creator_credit: Coastal Community Colleges and David P. Stone
results.brief_description:
Episode number 18 of Series “Universe: the infinite frontier: an introductory astronomy telecourse”.
Philosophers and scientists have pondered not only our beginning, but also our end. Will the universe end in “fire or ice”? As the universe expands, galaxies move away from each other. If this happens infinitely, eventually there would be an expanse of dark and little or no light. The forces of gravity however also operate, eventually pulling galaxies closer together. The key to the fate of the universe lies in the study of Dark Matter, the seemingly empty space between bright objects. Astronomers put forward many theories about the composition and purpose of the Dark Matter. Discusses the concepts of the Closed Universe and the Open Universe.

results.title: The Fate of Lee Khan [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: King Hu Film Productions, Golden Harvest and King Hu
results.brief_description: A martial arts historical epic of deceit, vengeance, treachery and bloody retribution. In 1366 Yuan dynasty China is ruled by Mongol invaders. Lee Khan, a ruthless, decadent aristocrat and master swordsman, and his beautiful but heartless sister, attempt defend their corrupt legacy of privilege and power. They face defeat when group of Chinese national revolutionaries organize and wage a great uprising against their Mongolian oppressors. Cast includes Angela Mao, Hsu Feng, Roy Chiao. In Cantonese with English subtitles.

results.title: The Fatal glass of beer
results.creator_credit: Mack Sennett Comedies, Mack Sennett and Clyde Bruckman
results.brief_description: This film is about a prodigal son returning to a snowbound cabin in the Yukon. Described as an absurd star comedy with appeal to addicts only: most of the humour consists of repeats of one line, “Taint a fit night out for man nor beast”. This film was written by W.C. Fields who also starred in it, along with Rosemary Theby, George Chandler and Richard Cramer.

results.title: The Fatal game
results.creator_credit: J A A Films, Orana Films, Richard Dennison and James Heyward
results.brief_description: Australian Mike Rheinberger has made six attempts to reach the top of Mount Everest. His dream of conquering the mountain has become an obsession. On his seventh attempt, he and companion Mark Whetu finally reach the top and soon plunge into nightmare. After the elation of victory comes the realisation that it is too late to walk down to camp before nightfall. At 29,000 feet, they bivouac on a ridge, enduring temperatures of minus 25 degrees Celsius. The pair survives the night in what in called “the death zone” only to be awakened to a situation of extreme urgency. Mark Whetu is left to make a decision that will stay with him forever …

results.title: The Fat young nymphs
results.creator_credit: Australian Broadcasting Commission and Brian Adams
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Landscape with figures: the art of Australia”.
One of a series in which Robert Hughes surveys Australia’s art from the time of the first fleet to the present day. In the years up to the end of World War I, Australian artists made a concerted effort to impress themselves on the world at large. Hughes looks at the work of Norman Lindsay, Sydney Long, George Lambert, Hugh Ramsay, Emmanuel Phillips Fox, Rupert Bunny and sculptor Bertram McKennal.

results.title: The Fat film
results.brief_description: This film demonstrates in a humorous manner the social difficulties encountered by an individual undertaking a weight reduction plan. It presents the story of Kate, her resolve to begin a diet, her failure to maintain it, and her resolution to try again. Related issues include peer pressure, the social significance of food, stereotyping, public/media image of the body ideal.
